creator: jesse.glick@netbeans.com
text:
Every page in the Ant manual seems to have:

<title>Apache Ant User Manual</title>

They should be a little more specific, e.g.:

<title>Apache Ant User Manual - javac</title>

Try building a full-text search database on the manual or something similar and
watch your query for "JSP" return (for example):

90% Apache Ant User Manual
51% Apache Ant User Manual
20% Apache Ant User Manual
20% Apache Ant User Manual

Not very helpful. Noticed in the context of a JavaHelp conversion of the manual.

When agreement is reached on the format of the titles I'll tackle some or all 
of these changes.  I should have noticed this myself.
creator: jakarta@ehatchersolutions.com
sbailliez@apache.org
text: We should probably convert the html to xml and generate the html via Anakia...

Actually, a better long-term goal would be to move to XDoclet capability such 
that the task documentation is built into the .java file and the XML format 
gets generated from there.  With my recent big documentation patch it will make 
it DOM'ifying a bit easier - so we could generate fairly good XML straight from 
the HTML soon.  Converting to XDoclet will require more thought, but certainly 
going to XML as an intermediate step would be good.

text:
Thanks! Looks fine. Reopening just because some of the top-level pages were
forgotten; attaching patch.

Pages which are purely indices (list of links) hardly need a title, as they
would only be useful in the context of a frameset. These can be skipped during
JavaHelp conversion, for example, and I expect the same is true of other formats.
